awards: On the Spot Award for creating an NLP-based Q&A System using GPT-2

achievements: Thesis: Deep learning and machine learning techniques for security
Coursework: Software Engineering (MLOps), Storytelling for Data Science, Machine Learning, Data Visualization
Thesis: Contextual Text Summarization for emails

Coursework: Machine learning, Natural language processing, Soft Computing, Database Systems, Algorithms and Data Structures, Automata theory, Distributed Systems, Computer Graphics, Image processing, Cloud computing
Developed a personalized agentic shopping assistant for Canadian Tire to enhance the shopping experience using OpenAI SDK, FastMCP, Weaviate, LangSmith, and Gemini

Designed, Architected, and implemented LLMOps Framework: Utilized LangSmith, Azure Databricks, and MLFlow to create a robust framework for managing large language models (LLMs) in production environments

Led the development of a Generative AI solution to automatically summarize and extract key insights from diverse SOC reports, enabling CTC to reduce auditor hiring costs by 70% using Ragas, Docker, Kubernetes, Azure and OpenAI

Implemented LLM Models to generate, evaluate and edit SRED reports, including an RAG pipeline to retrieve relevant information from knowledge bases using AWS (EC2, Redis, Lambda function), OpenAI, Ragas, etc, with role-based access control (RBAC) and prompt-level logging

Fine-tuned a Large Language Model (LLM) using PyTorch, Ray, FastAPI, Redis, LangSmith and Docker, incorporating human-in-the-loop feedback to iteratively optimize performance and output quality across real-world use cases

Spearheaded engineering-led digital transformation by architecting and migrating legacy Excel-based ETL workflows into scalable, production-grade Databricks pipelines—eliminating manual bottlenecks and enabling real-time analytics
Led the development of an enterprise-grade internal ChatGPT integrated with a secure knowledge store for contextualized retrieval

Developed CI/CD Pipelines: Designed and implemented continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) pipelines using Azure DevOps and Databricks jobs, streamlining the operationalization of the ML/LLM lifecycle
Developed supervised machine learning models to perform vulnerability management, achieving a classification accuracy of 92%

Led a team of 3 interns to develop a large-scale Transformer-based (BERT-based) vulnerability classification outperforming the state of the art by 30%, resulting in a paper accepted to ASE 2024 and a research grant of 100K CAD
Implemented a large-scale experimentation pipeline to benchmark the state-of-the-art LLM models for vulnerability detection (20 models)
Developed weekly reports & dashboards using Tableau, summarizing the vulnerabilities & impact on the overall security
Built large-scale data pipelines (SQL, Python, AWS) to generate new open-source packages, querying millions of repos, users & their interaction data to build a recommendation system

Part of the core machine learning team for designing machine learning algorithms (including XGBoost, Decision Trees, etc) to predict and optimize batch operations for the product – ignio WorkLoadManagement (WLM)
Developed time series forecasting models (including ARIMA, SARIMA) for prediction of Batch network node runtimes, AIOPs network CPU utilization and memory usage
Developed large-scale A/B experiments (testing of new product & UI features for NBS banking app) leading to a 13% increase in loan applicants
Designed an outlier detection system to derive substance abuse from records of purchase using (SARIMA, and RNN) with an accuracy of 80% for Loblaws Pharma

Won the "On the Spot Award" for creating an NLP-based Q&A System using GPT-2, Named Entity Recognition (NER) to interact with the insights generated by ignio, increasing product trust and usability by 40%

publications.title: NLP classification of Stack Overflow Questions
publications.description: Fine-tuned GPT-3 using data mined from multiple sources for the classification of StackOverflow questions for enabling better NLP-based recommendations to users with 83% accuracy.

projects.description: Developed a heart attack prediction system (random forest & XGBoost-based methods with an accuracy of 92%). Designed a large-scale recommendation system to recommend clinical trials based on patient profiles using data from clinicaltrials.gov and CDC. Model deployment on Azure using fastAPI, Docker.
